body:
I think you can leave this line as a code comment instead of logging it.

For the logging in general, would you mind prefixing the decimal values with 0? e.g. s/.15/0.15/

This is personal taste, so feel free to ignore, but I think it's unnecessarily verbose to add "that" after "Test..."
diff_hunk:
@@ -88,24 +88,22 @@ def test_feefilter(self):
 
         conn = self.nodes[0].add_p2p_connection(TestP2PConn())
 
-        # Test that invs are received by test connection for all txs at
-        # feerate of .2 sat/byte
+        self.log.info("Test that txs paying .2 sat/byte are being received by test connection")
         node1.settxfee(Decimal("0.00000200"))
         txids = [node1.sendtoaddress(node1.getnewaddress(), 1) for x in range(3)]
         assert allInvsMatch(txids, conn)
         conn.clear_invs()
 
-        # Set a filter of .15 sat/byte on test connection
+        self.log.info("Set a fee filter of .15 sat/byte on test connection")

body:
Before I had done it using a lambda and an assignment, the the following way:
```
invs_match = lambda: sorted(invs_expected) == sorted(self.txinvs)
test_framework.wait_until(invs_match, timeout=60, lock=mininode_lock)
```
but then flake8 would give the following error:
`p2p_feefilter.py:41:9: E731 do not assign a lambda expression, use a def`

Directly using the lambda on place of the parameter of `wait_until` works though, done.

+        def invs_match():
+            return sorted(invs_expected) == sorted(self.txinvs)

+        # whitelist all peers to speed up tx relay / mempool sync

body: Thans a lot for reviewing jonatack! Force-pushed with your suggested changes.

I wonder if we can eek some more perf by memoizing (untested):
```suggestion
        expected_txinvs = sorted(invs_expected)
        test_framework.wait_until(lambda: sorted(self.txinvs) == expected_txinvs),
```

+    def wait_for_invs_to_match(self, test_framework, invs_expected):
+        test_framework.wait_until(lambda: sorted(invs_expected) == sorted(self.txinvs),

body: Rebased on master and added suggested changes by jonatack (only sort expected invs once, use correct terminology regarding noban permission terminology).
c063dce9 nit: if you have to retouch, can remove "being" here and in line 87.

         conn = self.nodes[0].add_p2p_connection(TestP2PConn())
 
-        # Test that invs are received by test connection for all txs at
-        # feerate of .2 sat/byte
+        self.log.info("Test txs paying 0.2 sat/byte are being received by test connection")
         node1.settxfee(Decimal("0.00000200"))
         txids = [node1.sendtoaddress(node1.getnewaddress(), 1) for x in range(3)]
-        assert allInvsMatch(txids, conn)
+        conn.wait_for_invs_to_match(self, txids)
         conn.clear_invs()
 
-        # Set a filter of .15 sat/byte on test connection
+        # Set a fee filter of 0.15 sat/byte on test connection
         conn.send_and_ping(msg_feefilter(150))
 
-        # Test that txs are still being received by test connection (paying .15 sat/byte)
+        self.log.info("Test txs paying 0.15 sat/byte are being received by test connection")

### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* #19674 (refactor: test: use throwaway _ variable for unused loop counters by theStack)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

+    def wait_for_invs_to_match(self, test_framework, invs_expected):

body: Thanks for reviewing Marco. Force-pushed with your suggestions and a small log-message change proposed by jonatack  previously (https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/19564#discussion_r465517818).
